intro: Paraixeris dentata, commonly known as the toothed paraixeris, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
